front.div:
An electrodeposition-annealing route to films of the promising p-type absorber material Cu 2 ZnSnS 4 (CZTS)
using layered metal precursors is studied. The dependence of device performance on composition is
investigated, and it is shown that a considerable Cu-deficiency is desirable to produce effective material, as
measured by photoelectrochemical measurements employing the Eu
3+/2+ redox couple. The differing effects
of using elemental sulphur and H 2 S as sulphur sources during annealing are also studied, and it is
demonstrated that H 2 S annealing results in films with improved crystallinity.
